challengeName: Event App for Salesforce.com on iOS- Minor Enhancements
detailedRequirements:
Introduction

Event App is an iOS app (optimized for the iPad), that will read a QR code, parse the data, and post a chatter message via the salesforce Chatter API. 

There are some Minor Change we need to have in the app:

Required changes:

1. We want the user to be able to toggle between the front and back camera

    Add an icon in the top-right corner. When the user clicks this icon the camera should toggle between front and back

2. Remove the text with arrow pointing to the camera

3. Small unobtrusive error message on the screen : If an error occurs (with chatter or smartsheet API calls) put a small unobtrusive error message on the screen (such as small red text at the bottom).  The most likely case will simply be that the internet connection has dropped.  Note that the app should continue working regardless.

Also Add a configurable build parameter that toggles the display on screen of diagnostic log data of the background processes. 

By default the user should see only the simple "Welcome Cory McIlroy" message in the UI. However, for troubleshooting purposes, it would be helpful to have some unobtrusive indication of the state of the background processes, and if there are errors. 

4. Update the deployment doc: Update the deployment doc with more information for setting up our own Salesforce OAuth client.

 

This is the Application Flow:

  1. The default state of the app should be in "QR scanning" mode.  Use the camera as selected by the user, and display the live feed on the screen, with an indication of where the qr code should be positioned.  Use your creativity and best practices to make this a pleasant experience.
  2. If data is successfully parsed from the QR code, then display the "welcome" message with the user's name and company
  3. In the background, send message to chatter API and save the log.
  4. Timeout after 5 seconds (duration is configurable), and include a non-intrusive "countdown timer" to show the user when they will be directed back to the scanning screen
  5. If there is an error parsing the code, display a simple error message instead of step #2 above, and omit #3

You are responsible for obtaining your own salesforce dev org (free) in order to test with the Chatter API.  You are also responsible for your own google, dropbox or smartsheet for your testing.  A sample qr code is attached (PNG file), but you'll have to deal with the fact that the userID won't exist in your salesforce dev org.

Existing App source code is provided in the Forums.

* This is Time critical and we want these changes as soon as possible. Quick turn around is highly appreciated.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Provide the updated xcode project

Include a demo video, installation Instructions document or readme file
